properties.otherAdvice: The Cowra Carnival of Cups will be held on Sunday 12 November at the Cowra showground. There will be speed reduction, no parking zones and stop slow traffic on the Mid Western Highway (Grenfell Road)

properties.publicTransport: Extra trains will run for event participants. Visit transportnsw.info for more details.
properties.otherAdvice:
Up to 10,000 cyclists will ride from Sydney to Wollongong for the annual MS Gong Ride. The 82 km ride from Tempe Recreation Reserve starts from 6am and the 54km ride will start at Preston Park, Engadine from 7am. Both events finish at Lang Park, Wollongong by 4pm.

Road and lane closures will be in place along sections of the course.

  • 4am to 9:30am from Tempe to Sutherland: sections of West Botany St, Holbeach Ave and Bestic St. The speed limit will be reduced to 60/km along Rocky Point Rd/Taren Point Rd from Sans Souci to Taren Point.
  • 5am to 10am from Sutherland to Waterfall: Lane closures on the Princes Hwy from Kirrawee to Loftus and the speed limit will be reduced to 60km/h from Kirrawee to Waterfall. Delays are expected travelling southbound on the Princes Hwy during this time. 
  • 5am to 2:30pm in the Royal National Park: McKell Ave, Lady Wakehurst Dr, Sir Bertram Stevens Dr and Otford Rd. Access to the Royal National Park is via Farnell Ave only. The speed limit will be reduced to 40km/h along Lawrence Hargrave Dr from Stanwell Park to Thirroul from 6am to 3pm.
  • 5am to 4.30pm in Wollongong: sections of Bourke St, Cliff Rd and George Hanley Dr will be closed. Sections of Hector St, Marine Dr and Hinton St around the finish area at Lang Park will remain closed until 7pm. The speed limit will be reduced to 40km/h along Squires Way and George Hanley Dr between Fairy Meadow and Wollongong from 7am to 2pm

Motorists should exercise caution as cyclists will be sharing some roads along the course. Motorists are reminded when overtaking cyclists to leave a 1.5m distance on roads with speed limits over 60km/h and a 1m distance on roads 60km/h or under.

Special event clearways will be in place along key sections of the course between 4am and 4:30pm. Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed it will be relocated to the nearest legal parking space, use the Find My Car website or call 132 701 to find its new location.﻿

properties.otherAdvice:
Oktoberfest in the Gardens at The Domain from 1pm to 9pm.

Thousands of revellers are expected at Australia’s biggest Oktoberfest celebration at the Phillip Precinct in The Domain.

Traffic will be heavier than usual in the Sydney CBD on approaches to The Domain. Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time and watch out for pedestrians in the area.

A dedicated drop off zone will be located on Hospital Rd at Art Gallery Rd.

roads.mainStreet: Macquarie St, Prince Albert Rd, College St, Art Gallery Rd

webLinks.linkText: Living Futures festival day at The Coal Loader

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Living Futures Sustainability Festival at The Coal Loader Centre for Sustainability. Event starts at 10am and finishes at 4pm.

Roads are expected to be busy in the area and parking near the event is limited.

Motorists are advised to travel with their group and plan to arrive early to secure a parking space.

roads.crossStreet: The Coal Loader Centre for Sustainability

properties.publicTransport: Free event shuttle buses will run between 4pm and 6pm from the CBD to the Event Village. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
J.P. Morgan Corporate Challenge in Centennial Parklands. Event Village opens at 5pm, race starts at 6pm and event finish around 8pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual approching Centennial Park as participants travel to the event.

Hamilton Dr and a section of Grand Dr will be closed all day. Sections of Carrington Dr, Dickens Dr and Loch Ave will close from 1pm.

No vehicles are permitted to enter the Park after 1pm. Any vehicles inside the Park must exit via the Randwick Gates by 5pm.

Motorists are advised to allow extra travel time and to be aware of increased pedestrian activity in the area.

roads.mainStreet: Oxford Street, Moore Park Road, Anzac Parade

properties.publicTransport: Travel on transport is included for ticketholders. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Spring Champion Stakes Day – Everest Carnival at Royal Randwick Racecourse. First race at 12:30pm, last race at 6:10pm and concert from 6:20pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on Anzac Pde, Doncaster Ave, High St, Alison Rd and Darley Rd as crowds travel to and from the races.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads around the racecourse at the following times and locations:

  • 4am – 7pm: Darley Road between Alison Road and Centennial Park round-a-bout (western side)
  • 8am – 7pm: Ascot Street between Doncaster Avenue and Randwick Racecourse Ascot Street entry (both sides)
  • 3pm – 7pm: High Street between UNSW Gate 2 and Anzac Parade (southern side)

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

roads.mainStreet: Anzac Parade, Alison Road, High Street

properties.publicTransport: Travel on transport is included in concert tickets. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Paul McCartney Got Back Tour at Allianz Stadium on Friday 27 and Saturday 28 October. Concert starts from 7.30pm and finishes around 10:50pm.

With up to 35,000 fans expected each night traffic will be heavy on roads approaching the precinct, particularly during the busy Friday evening peak.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd. Fans are urged to catch public transport.

Driver Ave will be closed outside the stadium from 5pm each night and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the show.

No through-traffic will be available on Driver Ave. Access to EP2 and EP3 grass car parks and drop off areas will be maintained from Moore Park Rd and from Lang Rd. Please note EP2 parking is very limited due to upgrade works.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 3pm until 11pm each concert night including on sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
The Corrs at Qudos Bank Arena. Support acts from 6pm, The Corrs from 9:30pm and finish around 11pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching the precinct, including on the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

If you have to drive, travel with your group and pre-book your parking online to secure a space – available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close local roads in the precinct for pedestrian safety. For road closure details, visit the Sydney Olympic Park Authority interactive map..

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.publicTransport: Free return shuttle buses will run. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Paul McCartney Got Back Tour at McDonald Jones Stadium. Gates open from 5:30pm and show starts around 8pm.

Traffic will be heavier than normal on Turton Rd, Griffiths Rd, Newcastle Rd, Lambton Rd and Bridges Rd through Broadmeadow as music fans travel to and from the stadium during the busy evening peak.

To help crowds safely leave the stadium after the show, Turton Rd will be closed between Griffiths Rd and Lambton Rd and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NBL: Illawarra Hawks v Cairns Taipans. Tip-off at 7:30pm, full time around 9:30pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on on Burelli St, Corrimal St, Stewart St and Crown St as fans travel to the game in the busy Thursday evening peak.

Local roads around the stadium may close to help crowds move safely around the area.

Fans driving to the game on the freeway are encouraged to use the Masters Rd exit to avoid congestion at Mount Ousley Rd, both in and out of Wollongong.

Motorists are advised to allow extra time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip on public transport.
properties.otherAdvice:
By The C festival at Don Luas Reserve. Gates open from 12pm and acts start from 1pm. Finish approx. 9pm.

Heavy traffic is expected on roads through Cronulla and on approach to the park as people make their way to and from the festival.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on The Kingsway, President Ave, Captain Cook Dr and Elouera Rd, and be aware of increased pedestrain activity around the area.

properties.publicTransport: Route 337, 440 and 445 bus services will be diverting while road closures are in place. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to attend the annual Italian Festa held along Norton Street from 10am to 5pm. 

Traffic will be heavy in the area and on approach to Leichhardt, including on Parramatta Rd and the City West Link. Motorists should allow extra travel time in the area and expect delays.

Norton St will be closed between Marion St and William St from 3am to 9pm. Other local roads around Norton St will also be closed.

Special event clearways will be in effect on sections of Norton Street and William St from 3am to 9pm.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.publicTransport: Match tickets include travel on trains. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Western Sydney Wanderers v Western United. Kick-off at 7:45pm, full time around 9:40pm.

Traffic may be heavy on roads approaching and within Parramatta as fans travel to the game. Motorists should allow extra travel time on Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd, James Ruse Dr and Pennant Hills Rd.

Motorists should also exercise caution as pedestrian activity will be high on roads between Parramatta Interchange and the stadium.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
AFC Cup: Central Coast Mariners v Bali United FC at Industree Group Stadium. Kick-off from 7pm, full time around 8:50pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching the stadium including Central Coast Hwy, Pacific Hwy, Brisbane Water Dr, Donnison St and Mann St as fans travel to and from the game.

Dane Dr will close from 5pm between the Central Coast Hwy and Donnison St for the safety of pedestrians and will reopen once crowds have cleared the area.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Central Coast Mariners v Macarthur FC at Industree Group Stadium. Kick-off from 3pm, full time around 4:50pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching the stadium including Central Coast Hwy, Pacific Hwy, Brisbane Water Dr, Donnison St and Mann St as fans travel to and from the game.

Dane Dr will close from 1pm between the Central Coast Hwy and Donnison St for the safety of pedestrians and will reopen once crowds have cleared the area.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

The Mitchell Hwy (Summer St) will be closed eastbound between Sale St and McNamara Ln. The closure will be a 'rolling closure' managed by NSW Police. Westbound traffic will be largely unaffected, however there will be no access from Summer St into McNamara Ln, Lords Pl, Anson St and Sale St intersections. All intersections will have traffic controllers.

The Australian National Field Days will be held at the Borenore site (15kms west of Orange NSW) from Thursday 26 Oct to Saturday 28 Oct. More then 600 exhibitors travel to display their products and services during the 3 day event. A speed limit reduction of 60 km/h will be implemented on the Escort Way due to the increased traffic activity attending the event.

webLinks.linkText: City of Sydney - Sydney Streets series on Crown Street

properties.publicTransport: Route 304 and 352 buses will be diverting while roads are closed. Check bus service alerts and plan your trip at transportnsw.info.
properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and special event clearways will be in place for City of Sydney's Sydney Streets event on Crown Street. The event runs from 11am until 10pm.

  • From 9am to 11:30pm Crown St will be closed in both directions between Cleveland St and Foveaux St.
  • Sections of Arthur St, Collins St, Davies St, Devonshire St, Jesson L, Jesson St, Landsowne St, Miles St, Rainford St and Withers L will also be closed.
  • Motorists travelling from the south towards the city should detour via Cleveland St, Elizabeth St and Albion St.
  • Motorists travelling from the north should detour via Foveaux St, Elizabeth St and Cleveland St.

Allow extra travel time, follow the directions of traffic control and be aware of increased pedestrian activity

Special event clearways will be in effect from 8am until 11:30pm on sections of Crown St, Arthur St, Collins St, Davies St, Landsdowne St, Rainford St and Withers Ln.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.otherAdvice: The Lithgow Halloween Festival will be held on Saturday 28 October from 4pm to 9pm. The event takes place in the vicinity of the main CBD and there will be an increase in traffic volumes on both local and state networks. A small quantity of temporary traffic management signage will be installed on Chifley Road advising motorists of changed traffic conditions.

The Boorowa Touch and Netball Carnival is on Friday 20 October with changed traffic conditions in place from 8.30am to 4.30pm.

The carnival is expecting 7000 spectators and over 4,500 competitors from schools around Canberra and the State.

Alternating (stop/slow) traffic conditions will be in place on Jugiong Street to allow motorists to pass in one direction at a time.

A speed reduction of 40km/h will be in place on Lachlan Valley Way, Murringo Rd, Cunningar Rd, Bally Ryan Rd and Gereldine Rd.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NBL: Illawarra Hawks v Melbourne United. Tip-off from 7:30pm, finish around 9:30pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Burelli St, Corrimal St, Stewart St and Crown St as fans travel to and from the game.

Fans driving to the game should allow extra time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.publicTransport: ﻿Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Diljit Dosanjh at Qudos Bank Arena. Support act from 7:30pm, main act from 8:50pm and finish around 10pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching the precinct, particularly during the already busy weeknight peak.

Allow extra travel time on roads including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Visit Sydney Olympic Park Parking to pre-book your parking ticket and guarantee yourself a space, available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.publicTransport: Free shuttle buses will run around course in both directions. Visit transportnsw.info plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Over 15,000 participants will walk along a 28km circuit crossing seven iconic bridges in the annual 7 Bridges Walk event.

Participants will use existing off-road walkways and footpaths however there will be some minor road and lane closures in place to support pedestrian movements.

From 6am to 6pm Durham St between Church St and Heath Ave, and Heath Ave from Durham St will be closed. Managed access will be maintained for local residents.

Motorists should slow down, watch for pedestrians and exercise caution.

properties.publicTransport: Free shuttle buses will run around course in both directions. Visit transportnsw.info plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Over 15,000 participants will walk along a 28km circuit crossing seven iconic bridges in the annual 7 Bridges Walk event.

Participants will use existing off-road walkways and footpaths however there will be some minor road and lane closures in place to support pedestrian movements.

From 7:30am to 4pm lane 1 eastbound of River Rd will be closed between Lane Cove Country Club driveway (Stevenson St) and Greenwich Hospital Pedestrian Crossing (St Vincents Rd).

Motorists should slow down, watch for pedestrians and exercise caution.

properties.publicTransport: Free shuttle buses will run around course in both directions. Visit transportnsw.info plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Over 15,000 participants will walk along a 28km circuit crossing seven iconic bridges in the annual 7 Bridges Walk event.

Participants will use existing off-road walkways and footpaths however there will be some minor road and lane closures in place to support pedestrian movements.

From 5am to 4pm the following roads within Callan Park will be closed:

  • North Crescent between Park Drive and Supply Road
  • Central Avenue midblock between Military Drive and Supply Road
  • Military Drive between Central Avenue and Wharf Road
  • Waterfront Drive between Military Drive and Point Road

Motorists should slow down, watch for pedestrians and exercise caution.

The Lake Mac Food & Wine Festival will be held on Sunday 22 October from 11am to 5pm at Speers Point Park. A signalised pedestrian crossing will be in place to allow pedestrian movements. Exercise caution as there will be increased traffic and pedestrian activity in the area, as event goers make their way to and from the event.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NBL: Sydney Kings v Tasmania Jackjumpers at Qudos Bank Arena. Tip-off from 4pm, full time around 6pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching Sydney Olympic Park including on the M4, Parramatta Road, Homebush Bay Drive and Concord Road as basketball fans travel to and from the game. 

Visit Sydney Olympic Park Parking to pre-book your parking ticket and guarantee yourself a space, available until 11:59pm the night before the event unles sold out prior.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.otherAdvice:
More than 3,500 cyclists will take part in The Bowral Classic over two days this year Saturday 21 and Sunday 22 October. On Saturday riders will take part in The Crit races around Loseby Park, Bowral.

On Sunday riders will take part in a 150km, 120km, 85km or 35km ride, starting from 6.30am on Bong Bong St in Bowral travelling south to Bundanoon or Robertson before returning to finish at Loseby Park in Bowral. Changed traffic arrangements and road closures will be in place 

Bong Bong St, Bowral will be closed between Banyette St and Wingecarribee St. 

Other local roads in Bowral, Moss Vale and the Southern Highlands area will also close for the event. Local diversions will be in place:

Saturday

  • Bowral: From 8.30am until 6pm sections of Park Rd, Loseby St, Ascot St, Sheffield St and Park Rd will be closed.

Sunday

  • Bowral: Between 4am and 4.30pm sections of Oxley Dr, Park Rd, Station St, Wingecarribee St and Oxleys Hill Rd will be closed. 
  • Bundanoon: From 7.30am until 10.30am Ellsmore Rd northbound will be closed between Blue Gum Rd and Sallys Corner Road. 
  • Fitzroy Falls: Between 8am and 1.30pm sections of Nowra Rd to Myra Vale Rd closed to all traffic between Yarrawa Rd and Sheeowash Rd.
  • Kangaloon: From 8.45am until 3.15pm Tourist Rd/Kirkland Rd will be closed to southbound/eastbound traffic between Range Rd and Kangaloon Rd.
  • Glenquarry/Mittagong: From 9.30am until 3.45pm Range Rd will be closed to southbound/eastbound traffic between Old South Rd and Tourist Rd.

A speed limit reduction and stop/slow traffic control will be in place on sections along the Illawarra Hwy, Moss Vale Road and Nowra Rd.

Motorists should allow extra time and expect some delays.

Motorists are also reminded when overtaking cyclists to leave a 1.5m distance on roads with speed limits over 60km/h and a 1m distance on roads 60km/h or under.

roads.mainStreet: Various roads incl Bong Bong Rd, Illawarra Hwy and Nowra Rd in the Southern Highlands

properties.otherAdvice:
Th Murrumbateman Field Day will be held from Saturday 21 Oct to Sunday 22nd Oct with 20,000 expected to attend.

It is expected that traffic will be heavy along the Barton Highway for the duration of the event.

Alternating (stop/slow) traffic conditions will be in place on Barton Hwy at the Field Days entrance.
properties.diversions: Motorist heading to the event will be detoured via Euroka Ave, Patemans Ln and Murrumbateman Rd with access to car parking via Murrumbateman Rd.

properties.otherAdvice: Grapevine Gathering will be held on Saturday 21 October from 12pm to 10pm at Hope Estate in Pokolbin. Police control will be implemented at the intersections of Wine Country Drive and Broke Road during the event. Exercise caution as there will be increased traffic and pedestrian activity in the area, as event goers make their way to and from the event.
The Newcastle Pride Fair Day will be held on Saturday 21 October at Gregson Park in Hamilton from 11am.

The Rotary Newcastle to Dungog Charity Bike Ride will be held on Saturday 21 October. 250 riders are expected to participate and starting from Queens Whart Hotel Car Park and finishing in Dungog Jubilee Park.

Riders will ride in peloton formation in groups of 30 escorted by vehicles up to the Tourle Street Bridge. Riders will be shadowed by escort vehicles from then on (10 support vehicles) and marshalls will be positioned along route.

Route (also attached) :

Hannell St – Newcastle to Medowie Rd – Williamtown via Industrial Drive, Tourle St, Cormorant Rd, Teal St,

Stockton Bridge & Nelson Bay Rd.

Richardson Rd – Campvale to Pacific Hwy – Raymond Terrace.

Pacific Hwy – Raymond Terrace to The Bucketts Way – Twelve Mile Creek (15.5km).
properties.displayName: Rotary Newcastle to Dungog Charity Bike Ride

webLinks.linkText: A Day on the Green - Bimbagden

properties.otherAdvice: A Day on the Green 2023 will be held on Saturday 21 October from 12pm at Bimbagden Cellar Door. A reduced speed limit of 60km/hr will be in place. Exercise caution as there will be increased traffic and pedestrian activity in the area, as event goers make their way to and from the event.
properties.displayName: A Day on the Green - Bimbagden

properties.otherAdvice: The Hunter Bus Crash Memorial will be held On Saturday 21 October at the Singleton Showground from 10:30am. Exercise caution as there will be increased pedestrian activity in the area
The Crusty Demons Motorsports Tour Maitland will be held on Saturday 21 October from 3:00pm at the Maitland Showground.

properties.publicTransport: Travel on transport is included in match tickets. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Sydney FC v Melbourne Victory FC at Allianz Stadium. Kick-Off at 7:45pm and full time around 9:45pm.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on roads approaching and around Moore Park including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 5:45pm and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game.

No through-traffic will be available on Driver Ave. Access to EP3 and drop off areas maintained from Lang Rd. Kippax Park (EP2) grass car park will not be open for this game.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 3pm until 11pm including sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

roads.mainStreet: Moore Park Road, Anzac Parade, Lang Road, Eastern Distributor

properties.publicTransport: Travel on transport is included for ticketholders. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Spring Wild Card – Everest Carnival at Royal Randwick Racecourse. First race at 12:35pm, last race at 6:10pm and concert from 6:20pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on Anzac Pde, Doncaster Ave, High St, Alison Rd and Darley Rd as crowds travel to and from the races.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads around the racecourse at the following times and locations:

  • 4am – 7pm: Darley Road between Alison Road and Centennial Park round-a-bout (western side)
  • 8am – 7pm: Ascot Street between Doncaster Avenue and Randwick Racecourse Ascot Street entry (both sides)
  • 3pm – 7pm: High Street between UNSW Gate 2 and Anzac Parade (southern side)

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

roads.mainStreet: Anzac Parade, Alison Road, High Street

properties.publicTransport: Match tickets include travel on trains. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Western Sydney Wanderers v Wellington Phoenix double header. Men's match kick-off at 3pm, full time around 4:55pm. Women's match kick-off at 5:45pm, full time around 7:40pm.

Traffic may be heavy on roads approaching and within Parramatta as fans travel to the game. Motorists should allow extra travel time on Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd, James Ruse Dr and Pennant Hills Rd.

Motorists should also exercise caution as pedestrian activity will be high on roads between Parramatta Interchange and the stadium.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Macarthur FC v Brisbane Roar at Campbelltown Sports Stadium. Kick-off from 3:30pm, full time approx 5:30pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Pembroke Rd, Rose Payten Dr and Leumeah Rd as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Motorists should allow additional travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Pembroke Road and Rose Payten Drive

webLinks.linkText: Granny Smith Festival - Ryde Council website

properties.publicTransport: Route buses 515, 521, 544 and 555 will be diverting and using different stops while roads are closed.
properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to attend the annual Granny Smith Festival, running from 9am until 8:30pm. The event will be held along Rowe Street, Progress Avenue and Hillview Road from 9am to 3.30pm, Eastwood Plaza from 9am to 5.30pm and Eastwood Oval from 9am to 8.30pm, with fireworks at 8pm.

Motorists should allow extra travel time as traffic in the area will be heavier than usual while closures and local traffic detours are in place.

Local roads will close between 5pm Friday and 10pm Saturday including sections of Rowe St, Trelawney St, Progress Ave, Hillview Rd, Lakeside Rd, Shaftsbury Rd, Glen St and Richards Ave.

Motorists should also exercise caution and be aware of increased pedestrian activity in the area.

roads.mainStreet: Lakeside Road, Glen Street, Shaftsbury Road and Rowe Street

properties.otherAdvice:
The Spartan Race will be taking place on Saturday 28 October, as participants take place in multiple obstacle events. 7000 are expected to attend the event on Saturday with 4000 expected on Sunday.

There will be no right turn from Picton Rd into the event, motorists will need to detour via Maiden Bridge Rd roundabout.

Alternating (stop/slow) traffic conditions will be in place at the Maiden Bridge Rd roundabout to assist with traffic flow.

properties.displayName: Sydney Opera House 50th Birthday Laser Show

properties.publicTransport: L1 light rail services run regularly to stops at Darling Harbour. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
South by Southwest (SXSW) Sydney Festival from Sunday 15 to Sunday 22 October. Various conference and expo events will be held at venues in Darling Harbour including Tumbalong Park, the International Convention Centre and Aware Super Theatre.

Allow extra travel time on roads in the city and Pyrmont around Darling Harbour as traffic may be heavier than usual before and after events.

Motorists should exercise caution and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
SXSW Sydney from 15-22 October in the Sydney CBD. A series of conferences, festivals, an expo and parties will take place at vaious times and locations across the Sydney CBD.

Road closures and special event clearway parking restrictions will be in place on sections of Grafton Lane and Knox Street from Wednesday 18 to Sunday 22 October. Traffic will be diverted via Shepherd Street and Myrtle Street while closures are in place.

Motorists should be aware of increased pedestrian activity in the area and follow diversions while roads are closed.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

﻿Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator. arrangementElements.title: Road Closures & Special Event Clearways

properties.publicTransport: Buses will run frequently between the city, Bondi Junction and Bondi Beach. Buses will be in high demand so allow extra travel time. Avoid the largest crowds by visiting on a weekday instead. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
The Sculpture by the Sea exhibition returns to the Bondi to Tamarama coastal walk for 18 days from Friday 20 October to Monday 6 November. Changed traffic conditions and parking restrictions will be in place.

With up to 500,000 people expected to visit throughout the exhibition significant delays are expected on roads approaching Bondi and Tamarama beaches including Bondi Rd, Old South Head Rd and Syd Einfeld Dr. 

Motorists should avoid driving through the area where possible or expect delays and allow plenty of extra travel time, particularly on weekends.

Road closures and changed traffic conditions:

  • Local roads will close from 7:30am to 6:30pm daily in Bronte, Bondi and Tamarama including sections of Notts Ave, Fletcher St, Marks Ln, Kenneth St, Bayview St, Wolaroi Cr, Ashley St, Turner St, Cross St, Birrell St, Darling St, Silva St, Illawong Ave, Carlisle St, Rowland Ave and Wilga St. Access for residents will be maintained.
  • One-way traffic conditions will be in place around the coastal walk for the duration of the event from 9am Friday 20 October until 10am Monday 6 November. Allow extra travel time and follow the directions of traffic controllers and exercise caution.

Special event clearways:

Strict parking restrictions will be in effect each weekend of the event on Saturday 21 and Sunday 22 October, Saturday 28 and Sunday 29 October, and Saturday 4 and Sunday 5 November at the following times and locations:

  • 7am to 2pm: Bondi Rd from Oxford St at Bondi Junction to Sandridge St at Bondi Beach (northern side)
  • 12pm midday to 8pm: Bondi Rd from Sandridge St at Bondi Beach to Oxford St at Bondi Junction (southern side)
  • 8am to 4pm: Campbell Pde between Queen Elizabeth Drive and Beach Rd at Bondi Beach (southern side)

Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed it will be relocated to the nearest legal parking space, use the Find My Car website or call 132 701 to find its new location.

arrangementElements.html:

BRONTE, TAMARAMA & BONDI

7:30AM TO 6:30PM DAILY FROM FRIDAY 20 OCTOBER TO MONDAY 6 NOVEMBER 2023

Access will be maintained for residents and taxis only

  • Ashley St between Turner St and end of lane
  • Bayview St between West of Bronte Marine Drive and end of street
  • Birrell St between Tamarama St and Cross St (Eastbound lanes only)

The following roads will become one-way only roads for the duration of the event:

From 9am, Fri 20 Oct until 10am, Mon 6 Nov:

From 10am, Fri 20 Oct until 10am, Mon 6 Nov:

  • Dellview St from Pacific Ave to Fletcher St (northbound only)
  • Gaerloch Ave from Alexander St to Pacific Ave (southbound only)

webLinks.linkText: City of Sydney - Sydney Streets on Stanley Street

properties.publicTransport: Route 389 buses are diverting around Stanley St while it's closed for the event. Check bus service alerts and plan your trip at transportnsw.info.
properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and special event clearways will be in place for the City of Sydney – Sydney Streets event on Stanley Street. The event runs from 11am until 10pm. 

  • Stanley St is closed between Yurong St and Crown St in both directions from 9am to 11:30pm
  • Sections of Riley St, Yurong St and Chapel St are also closed during this time
  • Motorists are being detoured via Crown St, William St, College St and Francis St

Allow extra travel time, follow the directions of traffic control and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

Special event clearways are in effect from 8am on Saturday 21 October until 12:30am on Sunday 22 October on sections of Stanley St, Riley St, Yurong St, Crown St and Chapel St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.
